intro: Pilosella infecta, commonly known as the hairy leaf speedwell, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy leaves and stems, which give it its common name. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Pilosella infecta is often found growing in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in some regions.
